title: ZeroTrace: Privacy-Preserving Token Mixer on Cardano
summary: Cardano lacks a privacy-preserving transfer mechanism; all transactions are traceable, exposing sensitive financial behavior of users and large holders.
solution: ZeroTrace enables private deposits and withdrawals on Cardano using ZK proofs, hiding the link between sender and receiver while supporting compliance-friendly features.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Existing privacy solutions on Cardano are extremely limited: no native mixers, no zk-powered unlinkability, no shielded transactions, and no standardized privacy primitives. Users who require confidential transfers — enterprises, DAOs, NGOs, high-value traders — must currently expose:



- source wallet
- destination wallet
- asset traceability
- linkability of transactions
- wallet clustering metadata



ZeroTrace introduces the first practical, user-friendly, zero-knowledge private transfer system on Cardano, inspired by Tornado Cash but redesigned for Cardano’s UTxO model, deterministic execution, and Plutus constraints.



Key Innovations

1. Zero-Knowledge Note Commitment System

ZeroTrace uses Pedersen commitments + zk-SNARK membership proofs to prove that:

- A user deposited to the pool
- Without revealing which deposit
- And without revealing who they are



Every deposit generates:

- A note (secret)
- A nullifier (to prevent double withdrawals)
- A commitment (on-chain public value)



Unlike Tornado Cash, notes are generated client-side, not by the contract, eliminating the risk of note theft.



2. Unlinkable Withdrawals With zk-Proofs

Users can withdraw to any fresh wallet.

The zk-proof ensures:

- You own a valid commitment
- You haven’t spent its nullifier
- You’re entitled to withdraw
- No on-chain observer can link deposit → withdrawal



This provides complete transaction unlinkability.



3. Multi-Denomination Private Pools

To maximize anonymity sets while keeping UTxO execution deterministic:

- ADA: multiple pool sizes (10, 50, 100 ADA)
- Native tokens: opt-in pool creation
- Future extension: privacy-preserving NFT swaps

Each pool maintains its own Merkle tree of commitments.



4. Privacy-Preserving Fee Model

Fees collected:

- Deposits: tiny fixed fee
- Withdrawals: zk-proof verification fee
- Part allocated to a self-sustaining treasury

ZeroTrace aims for long-term operation without ongoing Catalyst funding.



5. Anti-Abuse Controls via zk-Policies

Unlike classic mixers, Zerotrace includes policy-based proof gates, e.g.:

- Withdrawal rate limiting
- Optional proof of non-sanction-listed origin (future)
- zk-based compliance modes for enterprise use cases

These preserve privacy while preventing system misuse.



6. Non-Custodial, Fully On-Chain

No centralized server.

No trusted setup beyond SNARK parameters.

No third-party custody.



All state transitions are verifiable & on-chain.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP will demonstrate a fully functional private transfer dApp deployed on Cardano Preprod Testnet.



Core MVP Features

1. Deposit Flow

User selects a pool size (e.g., 50 ADA)

Client generates:

- random secret
- nullifier
- commitment

Smart contract stores commitment

User receives encrypted note (local only)



2. Withdrawal Flow

User provides zk-proof showing membership

Contract checks:

- proof validity
- nullifier not used
- pool has liquidity

Funds sent to new wallet



3. Merkle Tree State

On-chain Merkle root

Off-chain generator for proof witnesses

API for retrieving tree states



4. UI Demonstration

Simple dashboard:

- Deposit
- Note backup
- Withdrawal
- Pool statistics



5. Access

Hosted testnet demo

GitHub documentation & sample scripts

Full zk-proof verifier in Plutus



The MVP proves the feasibility of zk-powered privacy in the Cardano UTxO model.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Today, transferring assets on Cardano publicly exposes:

- source wallet
- destination wallet
- complete historical link
- entire balance metadata
- transaction correlation patterns



This prevents enterprise adoption, compromises personal safety, and allows wallet clustering.



ZeroTrace addresses this by providing:



1. Private Transfer Engine

A zk-powered mixer system enabling:

- anonymous deposits
- unlinkable withdrawals
- zero-knowledge membership proofs
- double-spend protection via nullifiers



2. Client-Side Note Generation

Unlike older systems, Zerotrace never generates notes.

Notes are created entirely in the user’s browser:

- secret (random)
- nullifier (hash of secret)
- commitment (hash of note data)

This prevents front-running & note theft.



3. Privacy Pools with Structured Liquidity

Separate pools ensure deterministic execution while enabling anonymity sets.



4. Web UI + Wallet Integration

Users can:

- deposit tokens
- generate zk-proofs
- withdraw to new wallets
- analyze pool state

All via Lace, Eternl, Typhon, or GeroWallet.



5. zk-Based Anti-Abuse Controls

Future policy layers allow:

- rate limiting
- compliance-mode organizations
- proof of “non-blocked origin”

All without revealing identities.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
ZeroTrace strengthens the Cardano ecosystem by delivering a core privacy layer that is currently missing yet essential for the growth of a mature financial infrastructure. Privacy is not a niche feature; it is a foundational requirement for individuals, enterprises, and institutions who need to protect business-sensitive financial flows. Our impact spans across users, developers, and enterprise adoption:



1. Strengthening Cardano’s Competitiveness in DeFi



Most major blockchain ecosystems—such as Ethereum (Tornado Cash), Polygon (Railgun), and Aleo—already offer privacy-preserving payment solutions.

Cardano currently lacks an equivalent, creating a barrier for high-value financial operations.



ZeroTrace introduces:

- Unlinkable transfers
- ZK-protected ownership proofs
- Non-custodial privacy rails for DeFi

This significantly strengthens Cardano’s position as a competitive smart-contract platform in the global privacy-tech landscape.



2. Enabling Institutional and Enterprise Adoption

Businesses often need to move funds without revealing:

- supplier payments
- payroll flows
- treasury rebalancing
- investment strategies

ZeroTrace provides the privacy layer required for enterprise-grade usage of Cardano without violating compliance boundaries.



3. Expanding the Use Cases for Builders

Developers can integrate ZeroTrace as a plug-and-play privacy module into:

- wallets
- DEXs
- lending/borrowing protocols
- DAO treasuries
- payment gateways

This unlocks new opportunities for innovation in Cardano’s app ecosystem.



4. Protecting Everyday Users



Financial privacy is a fundamental right.

ZeroTrace protects users against:

- wallet surveillance
- transaction stalking
- targeted exploits
- unintended information leakage

This builds user trust and safety—critical for mainstream adoption.



5. Strengthening Cardano’s Technical Maturity

ZeroTrace showcases advanced technology within Cardano’s smart contract capabilities:

- Zero-knowledge proofs
- Merkle-tree commitments
- Cryptographic nullifiers
- Non-custodial withdrawal circuits

Such technologies lift the entire ecosystem’s technical ceiling and attract advanced developers to Cardano.



6. Contribution to Cardano’s Decentralized Future

ZeroTrace supports Cardano’s long-term goals of:

- self-sovereignty
- censorship resistance
- permissionless finance
- trust minimization

It allows users to leverage Cardano without needing to rely on centralized privacy solutions outside the ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
1. Demonstrated Technical Capability



Our team has direct experience with:

- Zero-knowledge proof systems
- Smart contract engineering (Plutus + Aiken)
- Cryptographic circuit design
- Blockchain privacy frameworks
- Security auditing and threat modeling
- Backend + full-stack integration for blockchain apps

This expertise is essential to deliver a mixer protocol with verified security guarantees.



2. Track Record in Delivering Complex Blockchain Infrastructure

The team has previously built:

- smart contract–based financial logic
- ZK-enabled identity layers
- treasury management tools
- UX-ready crypto applications
- secure transaction workflows

This proves our capability to deliver infrastructure-grade software similar in complexity to ZeroTrace.



3. Clear and Testable Architecture

ZeroTrace has a clearly defined architecture:

- Deposit contract with Merkle-tree insertion
- Note generation (random secret + nullifier)
- Zero-knowledge withdrawal circuit
- Backend relayer (for gas abstraction)
- Frontend client that constructs proofs locally

Each module can be independently tested and audited.



4. Validation of Feasibility

We will validate feasibility through:

a. Prototype ZK circuit benchmarking

We test:

- proof generation time (target: <2s desktop, <6s mobile)
- proof size
- on-chain verification cost



b. Security and Cryptography Audit

A third-party or peer-review audit ensures:

- no linkage between deposit and withdrawal
- nullifier collision safety
- no replay attacks
- Merkle proof validity
- no leakage of private signals



c. Testnet deployment

We will deploy a full version on preview/testnet to validate:

- user flow
- protocol anonymity set
- transaction costs
- relayer performance



d. Community testing & feedback

Open-source code allows the community to verify:

- transparency
- correctness
- trust minimization



5. Transparency and Accountability

We commit to:

- open-sourcing the entire protocol
- publishing milestones and weekly updates
- releasing audit reports publicly
- providing demonstrable testnet evidence
- maintaining transparent treasury usage

All deliverables will be verifiable by the Catalyst and Cardano community.



6. Risk Management Strategy

We mitigate risks by:

- using proven cryptographic primitives (Poseidon hash, Groth16)
- modular code design for easier audit
- predictable gas modeling
- fallback mechanisms for circuit regeneration
- adherence to Cardano’s off-chain infrastructure best practices

This ensures resilience and high assurance.



7. Long-term Sustainability

After Fund15, ZeroTrace can be sustained by:

- integration partnerships with wallets & dApps
- optional relayer fees
- community contribution
- open-source governance model

This prevents grant-dependence and ensures longevity.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
1. A High-Impact Core Primitive for the Entire Cardano Ecosystem

Zerotrace introduces a fundamental privacy layer that many future Cardano applications can reuse: DeFi protocols, DAOs, payroll systems, gaming economies, on-chain identity tools, and treasury operations.

Instead of each team independently building expensive ZK infrastructure, Zerotrace provides a reusable, standardized, open-source privacy module.

A one-time investment creates a long-term public good that lowers development barriers and accelerates innovation across the ecosystem.



2. Exceptional Cost Efficiency for a ZK-Based Protocol

Zero-knowledge engineering is typically resource-intensive and costly, yet the project is delivered with a lean team of four specialized roles covering all necessary layers.

The budget is tightly mapped to critical technical domains: smart contracts, ZK circuits, backend infrastructure, frontend flows, and project management.

No unnecessary headcount, no inflated costs, and no redundant spend-every ADA directly contributes to functional code, security, or usability.

The team has experience building similar systems, reducing research overhead and lowering risks compared to first-time implementers.



3. Fully Open-Source, Maximizing Long-Term ROI for Catalyst

All smart contracts, circuits, libraries, and documentation are released under open-source licenses.

Future Cardano teams save significant development cost by reusing Zerotrace’s circuits, verifier logic, Merkle tree design, and UX patterns.

This creates compounding value: Catalyst funds a single privacy layer once, but many projects benefit for years.

Open-source transparency also minimizes risk, increases auditability, and strengthens ecosystem security.



4. Low Ongoing Maintenance and Sustainable Operation

Zerotrace is architected for minimal operational overhead:

Optional relayer services are decentralized.

No centralized data storage or server dependency.

Circuits designed for low proving cost and efficient on-chain verification.

This ensures Catalyst funds the creation of a privacy primitive-not a system that requires constant financial support to remain functional.



5. Strong Team Composition Ensures High Certainty of Delivery

Each engineer covers a clearly defined, specialized domain:

smart contracts, zk-SNARK engineering, backend infrastructure, frontend UX.

The product manager ensures accountability, milestone adherence, and transparent reporting.

The structure minimizes delivery risk and maximizes the probability that every funded ADA turns into measurable, verifiable output.



6. Direct Alignment With Cardano’s Long-Term Vision

Privacy is a key requirement for real-world adoption of blockchain technology.

Zerotrace brings Cardano closer to enterprise readiness, user financial protection, and responsible privacy aligned with regulatory expectations.

This makes the ecosystem more competitive with EVM-based privacy tools-while leveraging Cardano’s stronger security model.
